pButton.Name: A
pButton.popInfo: St. Martin of Tours introduced Christianity to the Gauls in future France. Likewise, St. Patrick ministered to the Celtic peoples of present-day Ireland.

pButton.Name: B
pButton.popInfo: St. Benedict provided a new sense of order and purpose for much of the clergy in the monastic system.

pButton.Name: C
pButton.popInfo: St. Augustine, the “cerebral” saint, brought Christian teaching into harmony with Greek philosophy through his many writings.

pButton.Name: D
pButton.popInfo: Following the collapse of the Roman Empire in the West during the fourth century, the enforcement of laws vanished. The Catholic Church, with its newly created structure of dioceses, provided stability. Church teaching, called Catechism, provided rules for living as well as a sense of morality for early Europeans.
